signingServer.choosePolicySubTitle: Choose a spending policy for your Server Key. You can change it later, but note that updating it may enforce a security delay.

signer.coldCardInfo: Coldcard is an easy-to-use, ultra-secure, open-source, and affordable hardware wallet that is easy to back up via an encrypted microSD card. Your private key is stored in a dedicated security chip.
signer.coldCardDesx:
• Coldcard provides the best physical security.
• All of the Coldcard is viewable, editable, and verifiable. You can compile it yourself.
signer.tapsignerInfo: TAPSIGNER is a Bitcoin private key on a card! You can sign mobile wallet transaction by tapping the phone.
signer.tapsignerDes:
• TAPSIGNER’s lower cost makes hardware wallet features and security available to a wider market around the world.
• An NFC card provides fast and easy user experiences.
• TAPSIGNER is a great way to keep your keys separate from your wallet(s). 
• The card form factor makes it easy to carry and easy to conceal.
signer.ledgerInfo: Ledger has industry-leading security to keep your Bitcoin secure at all times. Buy, sell, exchange, and grow your assets with our partners easily and securely. With Ledger, you can secure, store and manage your Bitcoin.
signer.seedSigerInfo: The goal of SeedSigner is to lower the cost and complexity of Bitcoin multi-signature wallet use. To accomplish this goal, SeedSigner offers anyone the opportunity to build a verifiably air-gapped, stateless Bitcoin signer using inexpensive, publicly available hardware components (usually < $50)
signer.seedSigerDes:
• SeedSigner helps users save with Bitcoin by assisting with trustless private key generation and multi-signature wallet setup. 
• It also help users transact with Bitcoin via a secure, air-gapped QR-exchange signing model.
signer.keyStoneInfo: It offers a convenient cold storage solution with open source firmware, a 4-inch touchscreen, and multi-key support. Protect your bitcoin with the right balance between a secure and convenient hardware wallet with mobile phone support.
signer.keystoneDes: • With QR codes, you can verify all data transmission to ensure that information coming into Keystone contains no trojans or viruses, while information going out doesn't leak private keys or any other sensitive information.
signer.foundationInfo: Foundation products empower individuals to reclaim their digital sovereignty by taking control of your money and data. Foundation offers best-in-class security and privacy via openness. No walled gardens; no closed source engineering
signer.foundationDesc:
• Passport has no direct connection with the outside world – meaning your keys are never directly exposed online. It uses a camera and QR codes for communication. This provides hardcore, air-gapped security while offering a seamless user experience.
• Passport’s software and hardware are both fully open source. No walled gardens, no closed source engineering. Connect Passport to their Envoy mobile app for a seamless experience.
signer.mobileKeyInfo: You could use the wallet key on your app as one of the signing keys
signer.mobileKeyDes:
•To back up the Mobile Key, ensure the Wallet Seed (12 words) is backed up.
• You will find this in the settings menu from the top left of the Home Screen.
• These keys are considered as hot because they are on your connected device.
signer.seedKeyInfo: You could use a newly generated seed (12 words) as one of the signing keys
signer.seedKeyDes:
• Keep these safe by writing them down on a piece of paper or on a metal plate.
• When you use them to sign a transaction, you will have to provide these in the same order.
• These keys are considered warm because you may have to get them online when signing a transaction.
signer.externalKeyinfo: You can use a specific BIP-85 wallet on Keeper as a signer
signer.externalKeyDes:
• Make sure that the other Keeper app is backed up using the 12-word Recovery Phrase.
• When you want to sign a transaction using this option, you will have to navigate to the specific wallet used.
signer.serverKeyinfo: The key on the signer will sign a transaction depending on the policy and authentication
signer.serverKeyDesc:
• An auth app provides the 6-digit authentication code.
• When restoring the app using signers, you will need to provide this code. 
• Considered a hot key as it is on a connected online server
signer.biTBoxInfo: Easy backup and restore with a microSD card
signer.bitBoxDesx:
• BitBox02 is known for its ease of use, open-source firmware, and security features like backup recovery via microSD card, USB-C connectivity, and integration with the BitBoxApp.
• The wallet prioritizes privacy and security with advanced encryption and verification protocols, making it ideal for users who value high security in managing their bitcoin.
signer.trezorInfo: Trezor Suite is designed for every level of user. Easily and securely send, receive, and manage coins with confidence
signer.trezorDes:
•Sleek, secure design.
• Digital Independence.
• Easy hardware wallet backup
signer.jadeInfo: Jade is an easy-to-use, purely open-source hardware wallet that offers advanced security for your Bitcoin.
signer.jadeDesc:
•World-class security.
• Manage your assets from mobile or desktop.
• Camera for fully air-gapped transactions
signer.specterInfo: An open-source hardware wallet for users to take full control over their Bitcoin security.

inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletDescp1: Each key used in a multi-key wallet can also be used as a single-key wallet itself. Keeping funds in these wallets act as Canary.
inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletDescp2: If someone gets access to one of the keys and finds funds in the single-key wallet they may try to withdraw those funds. This will be detected by the app and the user will be advised to change that key from any multi-key setup.
inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletDescp3: These wallets can be accessed and funded from the Settings of any key
inheritancePlanning.canaryWalletCtaDescp: View keys' details or add new
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyOptionDesc: Create a vault with Inheritance Key
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyParagraph2: When the Inheritance Key is added to the vault a period to activate it is chosen. Until such a time it remains inactive. You can restart the timer anytime by performing re-vaulting.
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyParagraph1: While creating a vault, you can assign any applicable key as Inheritance Key. This key can then be kept with the heir or a trusted party. It will become active only after a given period.
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceKeyCtaNotes: Please provide detailed explanations and support to your heir via the inheritance document templates
inheritancePlanning.thoroughParagraph1: Carefully review all transaction details, particularly the recipient's address while sending sats. When receiving, your own address can be checked on multiple sources like the app itself and another hardware wallet.
inheritancePlanning.thoroughParagraph2: It is recommended to use atleast one hardware device with a screen. This allows to register your multi-key quorum on the device and thoroughly check transactions.
inheritancePlanning.preliminaryParagraph1: Before making significant transfers, conduct a small test transaction. This step verifies the transaction’s accuracy and confirms the smooth functioning of your multi-key setup, adding a protective layer to your bitcoin transactions.
inheritancePlanning.preliminaryParagraph2: This will not just ensure that the system is working as intended but will also be a practice for you before you actually need it.
inheritancePlanning.secureCoordinationParagraph1: Use encrypted communication for coordinating transaction approvals with other key holders. This ensures everyone is on the same page regarding the transaction details, protecting the integrity of your bitcoin transactions.
inheritancePlanning.secureCoordinationParagraph2: Please screen your key holders for trustworthiness in terms of handling the key and having your best interest in mind.
inheritancePlanning.crossDeviceParagraph1: To further enhance security, verify transaction details on multiple devices involved in your multi-key setup. This approach can help identify any discrepancies or fraudulent attempts, securing your bitcoin transactions effectively.
inheritancePlanning.crossDeviceParagraph2: You are encouraged to recreate the multi-key setup on another co-ordinator app to have complete independence from Keeper.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyParagraph1: Each of the vault (multi-key wallet) has configuration details that are needed during recovery.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyParagraph2: Your app’s meta data along with all the configuration files are stored on the Keeper cloud server encrypted with the Recovery Key.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyParagraph3: Simply backing up or noting down the Master Recovery Key gives you access to all this data which is updated automatically.
inheritancePlanning.masterKeyNote: Master Recovery Key also gives access to the app’s hot keys. Please secure the key properly.
inheritancePlanning.personalCloudParagph1: Wallet configuration files for vaults can additionally be stored on users’ personal cloud. This ensures that the user has access to them even if they do not have the Keeper app.
inheritancePlanning.personalCloudParagph2: You can choose a password for encrypting these files, make sure to write down or securely save the password as you will need it to access the files.
inheritancePlanning.personalCloudDescp: Use your iCloud or Google Drive
inheritancePlanning.walletConfigFilesNote: When there is a new vault or change in a vault the configuration file needs to be downloaded again.
inheritancePlanning.walletConfigFilesParagraph1: For multi-key wallets or vaults, it is important to have the configuration files along with the minimum number of keys needed.
inheritancePlanning.walletConfigFilesParagraph2: The wallet configuration file, also known as Output Descriptor or the BSMS file is an important item for vault recovery. Please store it carefully.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryComprehensiveP2: These backups should be stored in secure, discrete locations to ensure redundancy and resilience against loss or environmental damage.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryComprehensiveP1: Create durable backups of all critical components, like seed phrases and multi-key configurations, on both physical (metal tools for engraving) and digital (encrypted files) mediums.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryConductP2: Try all the methods for backup and recovery suggested by Keeper and see what suits you. Ensure you can perform this step during an emergency.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryConductP1: As a test, use the backup information to recover your multi-key setup periodically. The test ensures your backup’s reliability for restoring access to your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecovertPractice: Practice Recovery by Deletion and Restoration
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryP2: This process tests the effectiveness of your backup strategy, ensuring that you can confidently rely on it for recovering access to your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.backupRecoveryP1: After backing up your app and multi-key configuration, intentionally delete the setup from your primary device. Then, attempt to recover it on a fresh app installation or another coordinator app using your backup.
inheritancePlanning.backupKeepsBackupP2: Maintaining up-to-date backups is essential for seamless access to your bitcoin, providing security and peace of mind.
inheritancePlanning.backupKeepsBackupP1: Whenever changes are made to your multi-key setup, promptly update your backups and any associated documentation to reflect these adjustments. This includes revising recovery instructions and ensuring all backup mediums are current.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseDescp: Note down any set of seed words
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsDescp: Template to share details of contacts
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysDescp: Template to share useful key details
inheritancePlanning.recoveryInstructionsP1: Recovery Instructions is a document containing information and steps to be used by the heir to recover the funds.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryInstructionsP2: The document contains no sensitive information. It can be kept along with all the keys or separately.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryInstructionsNotes: Test the recovery using the instructions provided to ensure everything is in place.
inheritancePlanning.letterOfAttorneyP1: This pre-filled letter uses key fingerprints that uniquely identify the keys used in the app without revealing any other information about the setup.
inheritancePlanning.letterOfAttorneyP2: The information contained here could be used by the attorney or estate planner to create the will or other estate planning documents.
inheritancePlanning.letterOfAttorneyNotes: The key fingerprint information here does not leak any details about your balance.
inheritancePlanning.inheritanceTipsDescp: How to secure keys for the heir
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseDescpMain: Note down any set of seed words
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseP1: This is a simple template that can be printed out on a small piece of paper (ideally acid-free).
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseP2: Seed Words of any of your keys can be written down on them with an archival type pen and the sheet laminated at home.
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseNotes: Please ensure to never reveal the filled up document to anyone other than your intended heir.
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsTemplateDescp: Details of people to assist your heir
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsP1: A simple template to note down a list of trusted contacts and their details. This can then be stored along with the keys or separately.
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsRef: Refer to Safeguarding Tips for more details
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsNotes: Please ensure that these individuals would be willing to help your heir selflessly.
inheritancePlanning.trustedContactsCtaDescp: Contact details to assist your heir
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysMainDescp: Particulars about each signer in the vault
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysMainP1: This template provides a format to store the details of the signers or keys. These details are sensitive in nature. Thus the use of this document should be considered carefully.
inheritancePlanning.additionalKeysCtaNotes: Please ensure to keep this document up to date to avoid hassles for the heir.
inheritancePlanning.documentMultiKeyP2: Please make sure that your heir has access to the wallet configuration file and knows how to recover a vault using it.
inheritancePlanning.documentMultiKeyP1: Clearly outline your multi-key setup in estate planning documents, specifying who inherits your bitcoin. This ensures heirs have both legal rights and practical guidance for accessing their inheritance, bridging any knowledge gaps.
inheritancePlanning.educateHireTitle: Educate Heirs on Bitcoin and Multi-Key Security
inheritancePlanning.educateHireP2: Ask your heir to test the multi-key setups they create. This would act as good practice for them to inherit your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.educateHireP1: Proactively teach heirs about the importance of bitcoin security, focusing on multi-key practices. Well-informed heirs are better equipped to manage and secure their bitcoin effectively.
inheritancePlanning.selectKnowledgeableP2: Please ensure that the trustees are, trustable. Else you run the risk of them colluding to keep your bitcoin for themselves.
inheritancePlanning.selectKnowledgeableP1: Choose executors or trustees with a thorough understanding of bitcoin and multi-key systems. Their expertise will be crucial in managing and transferring your bitcoin according to your wishes, ensuring a smooth inheritance process.
inheritancePlanning.regularUpdatesTitle: Regularly Update Estate Plans and Instructions
inheritancePlanning.regularUpdatesP2: Please keep an eye out for firmware and other updates from device manufacturers. Sometimes buttons get moved around or processes change that would need to be updated in your instructions.
inheritancePlanning.regularUpdatesP1: Keep your estate planning documents and instructions regarding your multi-key setup, up-to-date. Changes in your setup or personal circumstances should be promptly reflected to avoid future complications for your heirs.
inheritancePlanning.simpleTemplatePrinted: This is a simple template that can be printed out on a small piece of paper (ideally acid-free).
inheritancePlanning.recoveryPhraseP3: 12 or 24 words recovery phrase can then be written down on them with an archival type penand the sheet laminated at home.
inheritancePlanning.acidFreePaperDesc: You can write them using long-lasting ink on acid-free paper and home laminate before storage
inheritancePlanning.activeMultiKeySecurityDesc1: A multi-key, also known as multisig, setup is crucial for enhancing the security of your bitcoin holdings. This method requires multiple approvals for transactions, significantly reducing the risk if one key is compromised.
inheritancePlanning.activeMultiKeySecurityDesc2: Seed word backups are vital, even with reliable hardware wallets, as devices can fail or get lost, ensuring you can always restore access to your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.diversifyHardwareDesc1: Please ensure that you keep abreast of various announcements and firmware updates from the manufacturers. Also ensure device accessibility using the Health Check feature.
inheritancePlanning.diversifyHardwareDesc2: Using different brands or models of hardware wallets for each key in your setup adds an important layer of security. This diversification protects against device-specific vulnerabilities, safeguarding your bitcoin from potential threats.
inheritancePlanning.backupsOnAcidFreePaperAndMetal: Backups on Acid-Free Paper and Metal
inheritancePlanning.backupsOnAcidFreePaperAndMetalDesc1: A point to decide is whether you want to store them along with the devices that have your keys or store them separately. This is an important decision and should be taken carefully.
inheritancePlanning.backupsOnAcidFreePaperAndMetalDesc2: For key backups, opt for acid-free paper and metal plates. These materials offer protection against environmental damage, ensuring your backup information is preserved. Metal backups, in particular, are durable against extreme conditions, keeping your recovery information secure.
inheritancePlanning.variedAndSecureStorageLocationsDesc1: This approach ensures that if one storage method is compromised, the others remain secure, providing a comprehensive safeguarding system for your bitcoin.
inheritancePlanning.variedAndSecureStorageLocationsDesc2: Store each key or backup in distinct, secure locations. Mixing physical (such as safety deposit boxes) and digital (encrypted cloud backup) storage methods minimizes risk, enhancing the security of your bitcoin holdings.

cloudBackup.cloudBackupScreenSubtitle: Backup Wallet Configuration Files on your {0}
cloudBackup.cloudBackupSubtitle: Keeper's Cloud Backup feature allows you to securely store your multikey configuration files and metadata on your preferred cloud service. This ensures that even if your device is lost or damaged, your multikey setup and related data can be easily recovered. The file itself is protected by a password setup by you within the app. This enhances the security of your BSMS file folder on your cloud.
cloudBackup.cloudBackupModalSubitle: Easily access your wallet configuration files from anywhere on any bitcoin wallet.
cloudBackup.cloudBackupModalDesc: Once initiated, the backups are updated automatically. Rest assured of having the latest wallet configurations.
cloudBackup.passwordDesc: Choose a password for encrypting your personal cloud backup files. Only the wallet configuration files will be backed up, without any private keys or other information.

notification.enhancedSecurityofVault: Enhance security by creating a vault for your sats. Vaults add extra protection with multi-signature authentication.
notification.noNotiSub: You’re all set — we’ll let you know when there’s something new.

concierge.getAnsweredWithConcierge: Here you can find help and support to resolve all your questions.
concierge.conciergeModalDesc: Please remember to never share private information, such as your private seed words or passwords. Our support team will never ask for such information neither in chat nor via any other channels.
concierge.technicalSupportDescription: Submit a ticket for prompt troubleshooting by our team
concierge.expertGuidanceDescription: Talk to an advisor for tailored support – first session free
concierge.conciergeAdditionDetailSubTitle: You can share your Device Details, Wallet Info, App Data, and Network Info.

concierge.onboardingCallSubTitle: We’re excited to help you get started. During this call, we’ll walk you through setting up your wallet and securing your account. Feel free to ask any questions along the way.

concierge.keeperConciergeTeamHelp: If you need assistance or face an issue, please feel free to reach out to our Keeper Concierge team to help you with any question!

usdtWalletText.selectCurrency: Select the currency you would like to use
usdtWalletText.dedicatedWalletSub: A dedicated wallet for securely managing USDT (on Tron) supporting fast low-fee transactions.
usdtWalletText.rampSub: Ramp allows you to acquire USDT using payment methods available in your country.
usdtWalletText.rampOffermultiple: Ramp offers multiple payment methods to acquire USDT.
usdtWalletText.understandRampPayment: By proceeding, you understand that Ramp will process the payment and complete the transaction. Keeper does not facilitate or handle the exchange.
usdtWalletText.hideWalletDesc: Hidden wallets can be managed from Manage Wallets in settings
usdtWalletText.backupWalletOrExport: Use to back up or export the wallet private key
usdtWalletText.sendOnlyUsdt: Receive only USDT via the TRON (TRC-20) network to this address. Sending any other asset or using a different network may lead to permanent loss of funds.
usdtWalletText.sendToWallet: Send to one of your wallets
usdtWalletText.sendtoTron: Only send to a TRON (TRC-20) address that supports USDT. Sending to an incompatible address may result in loss of funds.
usdtWalletText.gasFreeWallet: Since the GasFree wallet is not activated, an activation fee will be charged along with the current permit transfer
usdtWalletText.gasFreeWalletDesc: A Gas-Free Wallet lets you send USDT without needing TRX in your wallet. It works by covering the transaction fee in USDT instead of TRX. You’ll be charged a one-time activation fee the first time you use it.
usdtWalletText.permitTransferDesc: Permit Transfer allows you to authorize USDT transfers using just your signature.It’s efficient, secure, and keeps your wallet interaction simple.
usdtWalletText.UsdtPowerdBy: This USDT wallet is powered by
usdtWalletText.keeperDontControl: Bitcoin Keeper does not control or manage this wallet. If
usdtWalletText.becomesUnavailable: becomes unavailable, you may lose access to your funds. Proceed only if you understand and accept this risk.
usdtWalletText.importInfoDesc1: Bitcoin Keeper supports importing GasFree USDT wallets only. If you're using a compatible wallet provider that also supports gas-free transactions on the Tron network, you can import your wallet using your 12 or 24-word recovery phrase.
usdtWalletText.importInfoDesc2: Once imported, you’ll be able to access and manage your USDT without needing TRX.
usdtWalletText.importInfoDescNote: Note: Standard TRC-20 wallets that require TRX to move funds are not supported.
